com.milk.asynch
Class TimedSend

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.asynch.TimedSend
All Implemented Interfaces:
Orderable, SendSource
public final class TimedSend
extends java.lang.Object
implements SendSource, Orderable

TimedSend is the way to get sends to happen based on the passage of time. A TimedSend represents exactly one send. Scheduling it implicitly cancels previous schedulings. BUG: redo this class to use com.milk.timer.TimedRun!

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1998-1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

          the queue of timed sends, prioritized by time, most recent first

cancel

public void cancel()
Cancel this TimedSend. This has no effect if it never had a schedule in the first place, if it had already done its send, or it had already been canceled.

schedule

public void schedule(long when)
Schedule or reschedule this TimedSend to happen the given amount of time in the future.

Parameters:
when - when in the future (in msec) the send should happen
